result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Leon Banister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles Leon Banister is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles Leon Banister was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All court costs, surcharges and assesments be paid through collection by DOC in an amount or percentage the department DOC determines to be reasonable and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with D.C. or D.R.B.
No contact with children under the age of 17 years of age.  Court allows defendant to have contact with his own children.
Participate in sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary.

supervisions.notes: On 10/21/2016: Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Christopher D. Sobic is relieved of further representation of Banister in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Christopher D. Sobic is relieved of further representation of Banister in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32 (3).

Defendant Charles Leon Banister in court with attorney Christopher Daniel Sobic.  Defendant Charles Leon Banister in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen and Sara Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Machner Hearing proceeded.  Defendant waives attorney/client privileges for this hearing.   Sworn:  Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Court takes judicial notice of Document 13 as listed in CCAP.  Sworn:  Defendant Charles Banister, Assistant District Attorney Sara Hill.   Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.   Court finds a lack of clear and convincing  evidence from the defense and finds that the defense has not met its burden.  Court did not find Attorney Flanagan ineffective and finds no basis to withdraw his guilty plea.    No further action will be taken on this case.
Forwarded to Attorney Sobic

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Leon Banister in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Sara Beth Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  40 YEARS with 533 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- participate in sex offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary
- No contact with: DC or DRB
- No contact with  children under  the age of 17 years of age .  Court allows defendant to have contact with his own children
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $0; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and assessments be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Leon Banister in court with Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Charles Leon Banister in custody.  Sara Beth Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State filed Amended Information with the court.
State places on the record the reason for filing Amended Information as to Count 4 only.

Court holds colloquy with defendant.  With no objection by the State, Court modifies Amended Information (FROM: intercourse   TO: contact)
Plea hearing proceeds.

As to Count  4:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Counts 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Counts 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

As to Count 3:
Court orders Count 3  DISMISSED.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Jury trial is vacated.
Defendant remanded pending sentencing.
